description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军上将，中华人民共和国开国上将之一。曾任中华人民共和国国防部部长、国务院副总理、中共中央顾问委员会常务委员等职。
description.en: A General of the People's Liberation Army (PLA) and one of the founding generals of the People's Republic of China. He served as Minister of National Defense, Vice Premier of the State Council, and a Standing Committee member of the Central Advisory Commission.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任卫生部副部长。
description.en: Chinese politician, former Vice Minister of Health.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任国防科工委办公室副主任。
description.en: Chinese politician, former Deputy Director of the Office of the Commission for Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍次子，曾任总参作战部战役局局长，大校军衔。著有《从战争中走来：两代军人的对话》。
description.en: Second son of Zhang Aiping, former Director of the Campaign Bureau of the Operations Department of the General Staff, with the rank of Senior Colonel. Author of 'Coming from the War: A Dialogue Between Two Generations of Soldiers'.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍长子，曾任中国人民解放军第二炮兵部队副司令员，中将军衔。
description.en: Eldest son of Zhang Aiping, former Deputy Commander of the PLA Second Artillery Force, with the rank of Lieutenant General.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍之女。
description.en: Daughter of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍胞弟，曾任中华人民共和国外交部副部长、最高人民检察院副检察长。
description.en: Younger brother of Zhang Aiping, former Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs and Deputy Procurator-General of the Supreme People's Procuratorate of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军时期培养军事政治干部的学校。
description.en: A school for training military and political cadres during the period of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国防部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国防部
en: Ministry of National Defense of the People's Republic of China

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国务院

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院
en: State Council of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军海军东海舰队的前身。
description.en: Predecessor of the East Sea Fleet of the People's Liberation Army Navy.

nodes.id: 中国第一颗洲际导弹发射试验

zh-cn: 中国第一颗洲际导弹发射试验

description.zh-cn: 指中国人民解放军及其附属单位在改革开放后大规模参与商业经营活动的现象。
description.en: Refers to the phenomenon of the People's Liberation Army and its affiliated units engaging in large-scale commercial activities after the reform and opening-up.

description.zh-cn: 中国高级领导人，张爱萍孙子张辛亮的岳父。
description.en: Senior Chinese leader, father-in-law of Zhang Aiping's grandson, Zhang Xinliang.

description.zh-cn: 企业家，张爱萍之孙，汪洋之女婿。
description.en: Entrepreneur, grandson of Zhang Aiping, and son-in-law of Wang Yang.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍三子，原国防工办所属新时代公司副总经理，大校军衔。
description.en: Third son of Zhang Aiping, former deputy general manager of New Era Company under the National Defense Industry Office, with the rank of Senior Colonel.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍与杨纯于1939年结婚，1941年离婚。
description.en: Zhang Aiping and Yang Chun were married in 1939 and divorced in 1941.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍与李又兰于1942年8月8日结婚。
description.en: Zhang Aiping and Li Youlan married on August 8, 1942.

description.zh-cn: 张翔是张爱萍的长子。
description.en: Zhang Xiang is the eldest son of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张胜是张爱萍的次子。
description.en: Zhang Sheng is the second son of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张品是张爱萍的三子。
description.en: Zhang Pin is the third son of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张小艾是张爱萍的女儿。
description.en: Zhang Xiao'ai is the daughter of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张灿明是张爱萍的胞弟。
description.en: Zhang Canming is the younger brother of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张辛亮是张爱萍的孙子。
description.en: Zhang Xinliang is the grandson of Zhang Aiping.

description.zh-cn: 张辛亮是汪洋的女婿。
description.en: Zhang Xinliang is the son-in-law of Wang Yang.

description.zh-cn: 1928年8月由中国共产主义青年团转为中国共产党党员。
description.en: Transferred from the Communist Youth League of China to become a member of the Communist Party of China in August 1928.

description.zh-cn: 曾于中国工农红军大学学习。
description.en: Studied at the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army University.

description.zh-cn: 1934年春及1936年6月进入红军大学学习。
description.en: Entered the Red Army University for study in the spring of 1934 and June 1936.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国国防部
中华人民共和国国务院

description.zh-cn: 在赵紫阳担任国务院总理期间，张爱萍先后任副总理和国防部长。
description.en: During Zhao Ziyang's premiership, Zhang Aiping served successively as Vice Premier and Minister of National Defense.

description.zh-cn: 1938年3月，奉周恩来之命前往徐州面见李宗仁。
description.en: In March 1938, under the order of Zhou Enlai, he went to Xuzhou to meet Li Zongren.

description.zh-cn: 文革期间，在周恩来关照下，张爱萍得以匿名保外就医。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, under the care of Zhou Enlai, Zhang Aiping was able to get medical parole anonymously.

description.zh-cn: 1938年3月，张爱萍前往徐州面见李宗仁，提出对日作战意见。
description.en: In March 1938, Zhang Aiping went to Xuzhou to meet with Li Zongren and propose opinions on the war against Japan.

description.zh-cn: 1943年3月，在新四军袭击国军韩德勤部的战斗中，张爱萍指挥部队生擒韩德勤。
description.en: In March 1943, during the New Fourth Army's attack on KMT troops led by Han Deqin, forces commanded by Zhang Aiping captured Han Deqin alive.

description.zh-cn: 1944年9月，张爱萍接替阵亡的彭雪枫，任新四军第四师师长。
description.en: In September 1944, Zhang Aiping succeeded the fallen Peng Xuefeng as the commander of the 4th Division of the New Fourth Army.

description.zh-cn: 1949年4月23日华东军区海军成立，张爱萍成为第一任司令员，负责组建该部队。
description.en: On April 23, 1949, the East China Military Region Navy was established, and Zhang Aiping became its first commander, responsible for its formation.

description.zh-cn: 1954年8月，张爱萍任浙东前线指挥部司令员兼政治委员，负责组织指挥大陈列岛战役。
description.en: In August 1954, Zhang Aiping served as Commander and Political Commissar of the Zhedong Front Command, responsible for organizing and commanding the Battle of the Dachen Archipelago.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍作为副总参谋长，组织指挥了一江山岛战役。
description.en: As Deputy Chief of the General Staff, Zhang Aiping organized and commanded the Battle of Yijiangshan Islands.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍具体负责“两弹一星”工程。
description.en: Zhang Aiping was specifically in charge of the 'Two Bombs, One Satellite' project.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命中，张爱萍受到批判，被关押五年，左腿致残。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Zhang Aiping was criticized, imprisoned for five years, and his left leg was disabled.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平1975年主持整顿工作后，张爱萍得以复出。
description.en: After Deng Xiaoping presided over the rectification work in 1975, Zhang Aiping was able to make a comeback.

description.zh-cn: 在“反击右倾翻案风”运动中，张爱萍再次被打倒。
description.en: During the 'Counterattack the Right-Deviationist Reversal-of-Verdicts Trend' movement, Zhang Aiping was purged again.

relationships.target: 中国第一颗洲际导弹发射试验

description.zh-cn: 1980年5月，张爱萍组织指挥了中国第一颗洲际导弹的发射试验。
description.en: In May 1980, Zhang Aiping organized and commanded the launch test of China's first intercontinental ballistic missile.

description.zh-cn: 张爱萍对军队经商持批评态度，认为这“无异于自毁长城”。
description.en: Zhang Aiping was critical of the military engaging in business, believing it was 'tantamount to destroying the Great Wall'.

description.zh-cn: 改革开放期间，邓小平允许并鼓励军队各级部队经商。
description.en: During the Reform and Opening-up period, Deng Xiaoping allowed and encouraged military units at all levels to engage in business.

description.zh-cn: 1989年六四事件中，张爱萍与其他六位将军共同强调，人民解放军的枪口不能对着人民群众。
description.en: During the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, Zhang Aiping, along with six other generals, emphasized that the guns of the People's Liberation Army should not be aimed at the people.

description.zh-cn: 1989年六四事件中，叶飞与其他六位将军共同强调，人民解放军的枪口不能对着人民群众。
description.en: During the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, Ye Fei, along with six other generals, emphasized that the guns of the People's Liberation Army should not be aimed at the people.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东曾评价张爱萍：“好犯上！”
description.en: Mao Zedong once commented on Zhang Aiping: 'Likes to offend superiors!'

description.zh-cn: 叶剑英曾评价张爱萍：“浑身带刺！”
description.en: Ye Jianying once commented on Zhang Aiping: 'Covered in thorns!'

description.zh-cn: 邓小平曾评价张爱萍：“军队中有两个人惹不起，你张爱萍，就是一个！”
description.en: Deng Xiaoping once commented on Zhang Aiping: 'There are two people in the army you can't mess with, and you, Zhang Aiping, are one of them!'

description.zh-cn: 1989年，张爱萍与王震在一个“重大问题”（指六四事件）上发生了争执。
description.en: In 1989, Zhang Aiping and Wang Zhen had a dispute over a 'major issue' (referring to the Tiananmen Square protests).
